title: 1D Motion - x-t graph from description of motion

content.description: A cart is moving in the <math alttext="positive x" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></mpadded></math>-direction and passes through the origin at time <math alttext="t equals 0" overflow="scroll"> <mi>t</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>0</mn> </math>. The cart then moves with decreasing speed, stops, and moves in the <math alttext="negative x" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mi>x</mi></mpadded></math>-direction with increasing speed.
content.question: Which of the following graphs best represents the cartâ€™s position <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math> as a function of <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"> <mi>t</mi> </math>?

choices.label: The figure shows a parabola in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the vertical axis is labeled x. The parabola begins at the origin and moves upward and to the right until it reaches a peak about halfway along the horizontal axis. It then moves downward and to the right until it ends on the horizontal axis, far to the right of the origin.

The figure shows the graph of a line in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the vertical axis is labeled x. The line begins at the origin and slants upward and to the right until it ends high above the horizontal axis and far to the right of the vertical axis.

The figure shows the graph of a line in the first and fourth quadrants of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the vertical axis is labeled x. The line begins on the vertical axis, high above the origin, and slants downward and to the right. It intersects the horizontal axis about halfway along the axis, and continues downward until it ends far below the horizontal axis and far to the right of the vertical axis.

The figure shows a parabola in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the vertical axis is labeled x. The parabola begins on the vertical axis, high above the origin, and moves downward and to the right until it reaches a minimum on the horizontal axis, about halfway along the axis. It then moves upward and to the right until it ends high above the horizontal axis, far to the right of the vertical axis.
